results.title: Malcolm
results.brief_description: Malcolm, a simple genius played by Colin Friels, loses his job at a Melbourne tram depot after building his own one-man tram and taking to the streets. With funds dwindling, Malcolm is forced to take in a lodger, a small time criminal who moves in with girlfriend, Judith. Frank soon realises that Malcolm’s mechanical wizardry can help his career - the result - a series of oddball but unsuccessful robberies that culminates in the heist of the decade that stretches Malcolm’s devices to the full. “Malcolm” was critically acclaimed worldwide and received eight AFI Awards including best director and best film.

constellations_other.name: Processing grief through art
constellations_other.description: Thor: Love and Thunder begins with Thor meditating in a robe designed by Gumbaynggirr/Bundjalung artist Otis Hope Carey, best known for Ngalunggirr miinggi (healing spirit) (2020), a painting that expresses his grief over the loss of grandmother. Many artists process grief through their creative work.

results.title: Charade
results.brief_description: A Parisienne (Audrey Hepburn) finds her husband murdered. Four strange men are after her, and she is helped by a handsome stranger (Cary Grant)… but is he a hero, spy or a murderer? A mammoth audience teaser bursting with multiple identities, smart Parisian settings and Henry Mancini music. The song Charade was nominated for an Academy Award, lyrics by Johnny Mercier.

results.title: The Fallen idol
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, David O. Selznick and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: An ambassador’s small son nearly incriminates his friend the butler in the accidental death of his shrewish wife. A near-perfect piece of small-scale cinema, built up from clever nuances of acting and cinematic technique. Written by Graham Greene. Stars Ralph Richardson. Rated: PG

results.title: Girl with green eyes
results.brief_description: Girl with Green Eyes is a gentle and fragile story between a working class Irish girl and an older worldly writer. Their affair brings much discontent from Kate’s family, the church, and society in general because Eugene is a married man. The affair is further complicated by the interference of Eugene’s wife. Jealousy and insecurity set in for Kate which leads to an inevitable conclusion. Rated: PG

results.title: Algiers
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Walter Wanger and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A romantic Casbah thief (Charles Boyer) makes the mistake of falling in love. Hollywood romantic drama based closely on the French original, Pepe le Moko. laughed at for years because of the alleged line `Come with me to the Casbah’ (which was never actually said), it holds up remarkably well in its fashion. Rated: PG

results.title: Call It Murder
results.brief_description: A jury foreman is persecuted by the press, and even his family, after sending a woman to the electric chair. Stars Humphrey Bogart. Originally released as “Midnight”. Rated: PG

results.title: Tom Thumb
results.brief_description: Based on the Grimm Brothers’ fairy tale, this is a wonderfully fanciful motion picture filled with a host of stunning special effects. Soar away on the wings of your imagination to a world of forest spirits, where puppets come alive, where starcrossed lovers have their fondest dreams come true - where Tom Thumb will dance his way right into your heart.

results.title: The Horse thief
results.creator_credit: Tian Zhuangzhuang and Xi'an Film Studio
results.brief_description: Horse Thief is a magnificent saga of survival, filmed on location in Tibet by one of China’s most innovative young directors. The film incorporates images of many of Tibet’s great Buddhist ceremonies and festivals; traditions that were almost eradicated in the “Cultural Revolution”, but which are now again observed as they have been for hundreds of years. The film neither endorses nor attacks Buddhist philosophy, but it does offer the most respectful view of Tibetan culture yet seen in Han Chinese art. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Dumbo
results.creator_credit: Ben Sharpsteen and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: One of Walt Disney’s most endearing animated films is the story of Dumbo the baby elephant born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse.
results.description: One of Walt Disney’s most endearing animated films is the story of Dumbo the baby elephant born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse.

results.title: To Sleep so as to Dream
results.brief_description: To Sleep so as to Dream is the first film by Japanese director Kaizo Hayashi and it’s a knockout. Sometime in the late 50’s, an ageing actress from the silent film era hires a detective to rescue her kidnapped daughter. What she is really searching for is her lost youth and the unknown outcome of her first film, `Eternal Mystery’. It was never completed because of a puritanical backlash against women playing women’s roles. Moving back and forth between the 20’s and 50’s, from silent to sound, this is one of the most original films in years: a detective story with a really satisfying ending.
